patterns: Whether establishment of a new Technical Institution to offer Courses in Engineering and Technology is permissible in Academic Year 2021-22?
Can we apply for closure of the existing Institution and open a new Institution at the same premises?
Whether a New Institution is obligated to appoint a Principal and Faculty at the time of application for approval or subsequent to approval before commencement of the Course?
Our Institution was given Withdrawal of Approval in 2018-19. We are not able to apply under 2021-22 application.
The Institution has been placed under 20% reduction for 2020-21. How to get the fullIntake in 2021-22?
responses: The Council shall NOT grant approval to New Technical Institutions at the Diploma/ Under Graduate/ Post Graduate Level in Engineering and Technology in line with the recommendations of the Committee set up by AICTE to provide National Perspective Plan for Technical Programmes. However, establishment of New Technical Institutions in Engineering and Technology shall be permitted only in conditions as specified in Chapter I of APH 2021- 22.

Yes. The existing Institution applied for Closure of the Institution are also eligible to apply for starting a new Technical Institution in the same premises in the same Academic year. Technical Institutions applying under this Clause shall have to apply for Progressive/ Complete Closure of the Institution for the existing Programme(s) and shall apply for a different Programme. However, the Applicant has to make Material/ Non-Material amendment of the Building Plan, Site Plan, etc. duly approved by the concerned Competent Authority (if applicable) to suit the requirements of the new Programme. In case of change in Building Plan, the approval of present Competent Authority is required.

The New Institution is obligated to appoint a Principal and Faculty before the commencement of the Course. The Faculty to be appointed are for the First Year of the Course and it will be progressively done each year so that an Expert Visit Committee (EVC) conducted any time before the first batch of students has passed out, the availability of the facilities of an Institution as per the norms in Approval Process Handbook shall be verified.
You have to apply ONLY as a New Institution in 2021-22.
Institutions are required to apply for Restoration on the Web Portal.

patterns: We have got the first approval for our Institution in 2020-21. But we have NOT admitted students due the delay in getting affiliation. Do we need to apply for EoA?
We had applied for the Closure of the Institution, but now we have decided to apply for EoA. How can I revert the application?
We had 25 years of Live Lease at the time of our approval for establishment of new Technical Institution, currently our Live Lease is 5 years. What should we do to get the EoA?

In case of Institutions having Lease agreement for Land, the Council shall NOT issue EoA from the Year in which the Live Lease is equal to the number of years of the Course having the maximum duration. However, if such Institutions submit the Lease extended for further 30 years with at least 25 years of Live Lease, EoA shall be considered
We have not applied for EoA in the past 3 years. Can we apply for Break in EoA as well as for a new Programme?
Our Institution has extended EoA upto 2022. When we apply in the Portal for Increase in Intake, the Portal is calculating the TER Charges. Are we not exempted from payment?
responses: ALL the applicants issued LoA for starting the New Technical Institutions shall apply on AICTE Web-Portal for Extension of Approval (EOA) as specified in the Approval Process Handbook from the next Academic Year onwards, irrespective of the admission of the students. However, such institutes need to answer one Question related to this on portal in order to avoid deficiency.
You can inform AICTE as per the procedure mentioned in Clause 2.3.8 of APH 2021-22

In case of Institutions having Lease agreement for Land, the Council shall NOT issue EoA from the Year in which the Live Lease is equal to the number of years of the Course having the maximum duration. However, if such Institutions submit the Lease extended for further 30 years with at least 25 years of Live Lease, EoA shall be considered
Institutions are required to apply for Restoration on the Web Portal.
The Institutions applying under Break in EoA/ Restoration shall NOT be permitted to apply for other categories listed under Chapter II/ III/ V/ VI of the APH 2021-22

Institutions approved for extended EoA are waived from paying TER Charges for Extension of Approval (EoA) ONLY for the extended years for the existing Programme(s) and Course(s) at the time of issue of Extended EoA. However, such Institutions are required to submit the application for EoA and maintain ALL the norms and standards as specified in the Approval Process Handbook. In the subsequent years (within the duration of Extended EOA), if the Institution intends to apply for any other categories, the corresponding TER Charges as per Approval Process Handbook shall be paid.

patterns: Can we merge two Institutions located within same Campus/City?
Merging of two institutions are possible or not
Can we merge two institution within same campus?
merge two institutions within two campus
whether merging of two institutions possible or not
merge two institutions
responses: The existing Institutions of the same Trust/ Society/ Company operating in the same location/ city shall be permitted to merge into a single Institution with all the facilities at the proposed Parent Institution and/ or part/ full facilities of the Child Institution(s), if necessary. If all the required facilities are available exclusively in the Parent Institution (without depending on the facilities of the Child Institution(s)), as the Child Institution(s) shall be considered for Complete Closure. However, the convenience/ approachability of all stakeholders of the Child Institution(s) to the Site/ Location of the Parent Institution shall also be taken care of by the Institutions (including commutation). However, the norms of the concerned Regulatory Bodies shall also be fulfilled (Refer Clause 2.10 of APH 2021-22.)  NOTE: Intra-Day movement of Students and Faculty NOT Allowed under any circumstances (in case of infrastructure & other facilities required by Parent institution after merger are in multiple locations). Institutions going for such merger shall duly inform all the stake holders regarding schedule of conduct of Programs / Courses prior to admission.

patterns: Does AICTE allow Arts and Science Courses in an Institution offering Engineering Courses?
Arts and science in Engineering Courses
Both Arts and Science and Engineering in same institution
Whether AICTE allow arts and science with Engineering in same college
Are non engineering courses allowed in engineering institutions
Can we have Arts and Science Courses in an Institution offering Engineering courses?
responses: Conduct of any other Academic Courses (Technical/Non-Technical): The Institutions may conduct Academic Courses (Technical/ Non-Technical of any other Regulatory Body) using the existing facilities in excess or by creating additional facilities as per the provisions laid down in the norms and standards of the respective Regulatory Body without affecting the quality of education prescribed by all the Regulatory Bodies after taking NOC from the Council following the procedure specified in the Approval Process Handbook. However, the Applicant has to make Material/ Non-Material amendment of the Building Plan, Site Plan, etc. approved by the concerned Competent Authority (if applicable) to suit the requirements of the new Programme/ Level. The total land required shall be the highest amongst the programs/ levels being offered by the Institute. However, institute shall have sufficient built up area to cover all the requirements of ALL the programs/ levels conducted as per the provisions of Approval Process Handbook. The institute shall extends to provide ample space for play-ground (owned or hired) facilities for indoor and outdoor sports for the students either in the Campus or through arrangements with other adjacent Institutions, Corporation grounds, private facilities, etc.

queries based on portal
approval related issues for the approval process
Queries

Issues
Where to submit issues
approval related issues
responses: Institute are requested to raises queries only through online Grievance Redressal mechanism available on AICTE website under Approval Process 2021-22 quick links. No queries through email will be entertained.

patterns: Is it mandatory for an Institution offering Courses in Architecture and Pharmacy to obtain Approval from AICTE?
obtain Approval from AICTE for Architecture and Pharmacy
Engineering courses in Architectuere and Pharmacy
Whether it is important to get permission from AICTE for an institution offering courses in Architecture and Pharmacy
Permission from AICTE for Architecture and Pharmacy
Approval for Architecture and Pharmacy
responses: In compliance of the order dated 08.11.2019 passed by the Honorable Supreme Court of Indian CA No.364/ 2005, for the existing Institutions offering Courses in Architecture Programme, approval by the Council of Architecture (CoA) is mandatory and AICTE approval is NOT required.In compliance of the order dated 05.03.2020 passed by the Honï¿½ble Supreme Court of India in Transferred Petitions (CIVIL) No 87-101 of 2014, for the existing institutions offering courses in Pharmacy Programme, approval of Pharmacy Council of India (PCI) is mandatory and AICTE approval is NOT required. State Public and Private Universities and Central Universities are also not required to take AICTE approval as per the AICTE Act. However, some of the Universities are seeking approval of AICTE for availing the benefits of AICTE schemes/initiatives as per the prevailing policies/norms. Similarly, INTERESTED Architecture and Pharmacy Institutions may apply to AICTE as a New Institutions or for Extension of Approval (EoA), provided, they are already having valid approval of CoA and PCI, respectively on the day of application.

patterns: Whether establishment of a new Technical Institution to offer Courses in Engineering and Technology is permissible in Academic Year 2021-22?

offering of Couses by new technical institutions
responses: The Council shall NOT grant approval to New Technical Institutions at the Diploma/ Under Graduate/ Post Graduate Level in Engineering and Technology in line with the recommendations of the Committee set up by AICTE to provide National Perspective Plan for Technical Programmes. However, establishment of New Technical Institutions in Engineering and Technology shall be permitted only in conditions as specified in Chapter I of APH 2021- 22.

patterns: Whether MCA/ MBA Department of Arts and Science College is eligible to apply for AICTE approval?
Whether AICTE approval is needed for running MCA Course in our Arts and Science College?
running MCA Course in our Arts and Science College
Is it mandatory to get approval from AICTE for MCA Course in Arts and Science College?
Whether it is important to get approval from AICTE for MCA Courses in Arts and Science College?
Arts and Science College is eligible to apply for AICTE approval
AICTE approval is needed for running MCA Course

Department of Arts and Science College is eligible to apply for AICTE approval
Is MCA/MBA Department of Arts and Science College is eligible for AICTE approval
Eligibility of Arts and Science Department to apply for AICTE approval
responses: Yes. Refer Clause 1.3.5 of APH 2021-22. In case of non-Technical Institutions seeking approval for conducting MCA/ MBA and University Departments/ Constituent Colleges seeking approval for conducting MCA/ MBA/ M.Tech. Programmes apart from their existing Courses, separate building and Principal are NOT required. However, in such cases all other norms (as per APH 2021-22) such as separate Head of the Department, Faculty, Infrastructure, Built-Up area, etc. should be fulfilled.

Is a New Institution is obligated to appoint a Principal and Faculty at the time of application for approval or subsequent to approval before commencement of the Course? Whether the Faculty to be appointed are for the First Year of the Course or for the entire period of the Course?
responses: The New Institution is obligated to appoint a Principal and Faculty before the commencement of the Course. The Faculty to be appointed are for the First Year of the Course and it will be progressively done each year so that an Expert Visit Committee (EVC) conducted any time before the first batch of students has passed out, the availability of the facilities of an Institution as per the norms in Approval Process Handbook shall be verified.

responses: Applicants issued Letter of Intent (LoI) but rejected after the Expert Visit Committee shall inform the Council about their readiness of infrastructure after making the payment of TER Charges as per Clause 1.4.2 of APH 2021-22 through online mode for conduct of another Expert Visit Committee (EVC). The validity of LoI is Two Years from the year of issue of LoI. In this case the validity upto 2022-23.

responses: ALL the applicants issued LoA for starting the New Technical Institutions shall apply on AICTE Web-Portal for Extension of Approval (EOA) as specified in the Approval Process Handbook from the next Academic Year onwards, irrespective of the admission of the students. apply for closure of the existing Institution and open a new Institution

responses: Yes. The existing Institution applied for Closure of the Institution are also eligible to apply for starting a new Technical Institution in the same premises in the same Academic Technical Institutions applying under this Clause shall have to apply for Progressive/ Complete Closure of the Institution for the existing Programme(s) and shall apply for a different Programme. However, the Applicant has to make Material/ Non-Material amendment of the Building Plan, Site Plan, etc. duly approved by the concerned Competent Authority (if applicable) to suit the requirements of the new Programme. In case of change in Building Plan, the approval of present Competent Authority is required.

patterns: What is Food and Safety Act 2006? How to comply with its norms?
What is food safety acts and its norms?
Can you please say me about food safety acts and its norms?
I would like to now about the food safety norms and about the act!
responses: It is an act under Ministry of Law and Justice to consolidate the laws relating to food and to establish the Food Safety and Standards Authority of India for laying down science based standards for articles of food and to regulate their manufacture, storage, distribution, sale and import, to ensure availability of safe and wholesome food for human consumption and for matters connected therewith or incidental thereto. The provision under the act is available at http:/ / www.fssai.gov.in/ home/ fss-legislation/ food-safety-and-standards-act.html.

patterns: What is National Academic Depository? How to apply?
Hey bot how can I apply for the National academic Depository
I want to apply for the National Academic Depository. What should I do?
Can you please help me to apply National Academic Depository?
NAD
National Academic Depository
responses: NAD is a Unique, Innovative and Progressive step towards achieving Digital enablement of the Education Records. NAD aspires to make the vision of Digital Academic Certificates for every Indian a reality. NAD is not only a database copy of the certificate records for Academic Institutions but a complete system for Issuing Online Certificates to well identified and registered students.  It will be an active online place for Students, Academic Institutions and Verification Users. To apply, Institutions shall log on to https:/ / nad.ndml.in/ about- nad.html and proceed towards the link 'New Registrations'.

patterns: How can I Institution apply for National Digital Library?
What is the procedure to apply for the National Digital Library?
Can you please say me the procedure to apply for the National Digital Library?
responses: Ministry of Human Resource Development under its National Mission on Education through Information and Communication Technology has initiated the National Digital Library (NDL) pilot project to develop a framework of virtual repository of learning resources with a single- window search facility. The pilot project is devising a framework suitable for future scale up with respect to content volume and diversity to become a full-blown National Digital Library of India over time. It is being developed at IIT Kharagpur. To apply, Institutions has to log on to https:/ / ndl.iitkgp.ac.in/ and go to Institutional Registration. It is offered at absolute Free of Cost.

patterns: Whether e-Affidavit is mandatory?
Is e-Affidavit necessary
responses: E-affidavit is preferable not mandatory.

patterns: Is TER Charges refundable if application is rejected?
Will they refund the TER charges if application is rejected?
My application is rejected. Will I get the refund for the TER Charges?
responses: TER Charges shall not be refunded in any case, if the application is processed and rejected as specified in the Approval Process Handbook. However, if application is rejected at the Level of Scrutiny/ Re-Scrutiny (as per Clause 1.6 of APH 2020-21) without availing the appeal provision, TER Charges as applicable shall be refunded to the Applicant/ Institution.

patterns: We want to change the details which are non-editable/ read-only. How this can be done?
How can I change the details which are noneditable/read only?
Is there any way to change the details that are non editable?
responses: If the Institution intend to modify the Non-Editable fields such as name of the Trustee, Land details, etc. shall contact AICTE HQ with supporting documents.

patterns: What is the procedure for conversion of Technical Institution into Technical Campus?
May I know what is the procedure for the conversion of Technical Institution into Technical Campus?
How can I change the technical institution into a technical campus?
responses: There is no provision to convert a Technical Institution into Technical Campus. You can refer Clause 2.9 of APH 2020-21 for starting a new Programme/ Level in the existing Institutions. The Institutions shall be permitted to apply for ANYONE Level (Diploma/ Under Graduate) in an existing Programme/ a new Programme, not exceeding THREE Division(s)/ Course(s). However, the norms of the concerned Regulatory Authorities shall also be fulfilled.

patterns: What is the Faculty Student ratio to be maintained by the Institutions Deemed to be Universities/ Institutions having Accreditation/ Autonomous status?
Faculty student ratio
responses: Institutions Deemed to be Universities/ Institutions having Accreditation (of one or any number of Courses)/ Autonomy status shall have Faculty: Student as 1:15 in Under Graduate Degree Level in Engineering and Technology in ALL the Courses and maintain a better Cadre ratio in order to achieve excellence in Technical Education. All such Institutions shall create the necessary Faculty, Infrastructure and other facilities WITHIN 2 YEARS to fulfil the norms. Hence the Council will consider the issue of EoA till such time.

patterns: Do we need Research Laboratory for each PG Course?
Is research lab necessary foe each PG course?
Is it mandatory to have a research laboratory for each PG course?
Do we need Research lab for each PG Course?
responses: No. Research Laboratory is to be provided for each Institution offering Post Graduate Courses.

patterns: can you tell me about AICTE bot
about AICTE
Why AICTE is started
history of AICTE
purpose of AICTE
responses: The AICTE was constituted in 1945 as an advisory body in all matters relating to technical education.  Even though it had no statutory powers, it played a very important role in the development of technical education in the country.Even earlier, the Education Commission of 1964. popularly known as Kothari Commission after the name of its Chairman, made the following recommendation for the proper administration of technical education:To ensure the pursuit of the highest standards at the first degree and post-graduate levels, and to provide on adequate machinery with the national and professional concern with the future development at these levels, we have recommended the setting up of a UGC-type organisation, industry and concerned Ministries.  This body should have a full-time chairman, and funds should be allotted to it on a block basis.

patterns: about AICTE internship

internship details
responses: AICTE has prepared a model curriculum with the help of prominent academicians of the country so that the country may produce competent employable graduates as per the needs of the industries. The model curriculum includes the internship for students of six months' duration at different stages of the programme.

patterns: How do we implement the rationalization of nomenclature suggested by the AICTE in Management Programme?
How can we implement the rationalization of nomenclature suggested by the AICTE programme?
responses: The nomenclature of the Courses in Management after rationalization will be visible in your application. The revised nomenclatures are also communicated to all Universities. In case of difficulty in adopting the nomenclatures, the respective University shall be contacted or if the issue persists, raise your grievance in the Portal.

patterns: For Under Graduate Degree Programme in Engineering Technology, whether Diploma qualified students will also be considered on par with students passed 10+2 examination?
responses: Students passed Diploma (in Engineering and Technology) will be considered, subject to vacancies in the First Year, in case the vacancies at lateral entry are exhausted.

patterns: Is Adjunct Faculty being considered for the requisite Faculty Student ratio?
Will they consider the Adjunct Faculty for the requisite Faculty Student ratio?
responses: In case of Architecture -25%, Planning - 30% and Design - 20%, Adjunct Faculty/ Resource Persons are permissible, since the Programme requires exhaustive practical field exposure. In all other Programmes, ONLY under exigent conditions such as relieving/ retirement of Faculty members/ delay in Faculty recruitment, Institutions may avail the services of Adjunct Faculty/ Resource Persons up to a maximum of 10% of the required Faculty members as per the 'Approved Intake', for a period not exceeding one Academic Session. Refer Annexure 9 for the Guidelines for the appointment of Adjunct Faculty/ Resource Persons.

patterns: How can we apply for Courses in Emerging Areas in Engineering and Technology?
What is the procedure to apply for the emerging areas of Engineering and technology?
responses: You can apply for Increase in Intake/ Additional Course(s). The approval for the Increase in Intake/ Additional Course(s) issued in the Core Courses in 2020-21 shall be offered in Emerging Areas suitably in arrangement with the Affiliating Body. For details, refer Clauses 2.15 and 7.3.2 of APH 2020-21.

patterns: We have One Course with valid NBA accreditation. How many increase/ new Course our Institution is eligible?
Having one calid accrediation how many increase/new course our institution is eligible?
Our Institution is eligible to apply for NBA accreditation but does not have NBA accredited Courses. Can we apply for new/ expansion in PG Courses?
responses: Institutions shall be eligible for new Course(s)/ expansion of existing Course(s), equal to the number of valid NBA accredited Course(s), limited to a maximum of FOUR within the definition of Division/ Programme/ Level. Refer Clause 2.15.3 of APH 2020-21.

patterns: We have started UG Course in Pharmacy in 2009. Now we want to increase in Intake for our B.Pharm. Course and addition of PG Course in Pharmacy. We do not have NBA accreditation. Whether we can add a new Course?
responses: You can apply for increasing the Intake of B Pharm. from 60 to 100. But you are not permitted to add PG Courses.

patterns: Our Institution has valid NBA accredited Courses. Is it necessary to upload valid NBA letter on portal and send hard copy to Regional Office?
Should we send the hardcopy of the valid NBA letter from the portal?
responses: No. You can produce the additional documents including NBA letter at the time of Scrutiny Committee.

patterns: In B.Pharm., whether 100 Intake will be taken as one or two Divisions?
If we give 100 intake in B.PHARM., will it be taken as 1 or 2 divisions?
responses: One Division.

patterns: How much is the Development Fee is recommended by the National Fee Committee?
What is the development fee recommended by the national fee committee?
Can we charge the Fee as per the Recommendation of National Fee Committee given in APH 2020-21?
responses: No split up for Development Fee is available in the report of the National Fee Committee.
Institutions have to contact the respective State Fee Regulatory Committee for finalizing the Fee.

patterns: Please clarify the qualification and age limit of Adjunct Faculty. Whether a same Adjunct Faculty can be associated with different Institutions? Is there any Maximum no of Institutions that an Adjunct Faculty should be associated?
responses: Refer Annexure 9 of APH 2020-21. Adjunct Faculty shall not be engaged in not more than two Institutions at the same time.

patterns: Is it essential to have representative of AICTE in the Board of Governors?
Is it mandatory to have representative of AICTE in Board of Governors?
responses: The suggested composition of Board of Governors for the AICTE approved Institutions has been given in Appendix 18 of APH 2020-21. Nominee of the All India Council for Technical Education is mandatory to PGDM Institutions Only.

patterns: I want to know whether any applicant of the Organization can be the owner of the land or else if any member of the organization can give a lease to the applicant society. Moreover does the lease agreement needed to be registered or not.
responses: Refer Appendix 16.1 of APH 2020-21.

patterns: With reference to APH 2020-21, whether subscription of E-journal is mandatory?
Is subscription of E-Journal mandatory referring to APH 2020-21?
responses: Refer Appendix 10 of APH 2019-20. Subscription of the journal will add value to the quality of Technical education and skill. However, subscription of E-Journals is mandatory for the Institutions offering PG Courses.

patterns: In Appendix10 subscription of journals, what is B?
What is B in Appendix10?
responses: B is the Total number of Courses.

patterns: We are running Five PG Courses in Civil Engineering. How many Professors with Ph.D. qualification are required?
How many proffessors with Ph.D. qualification required for 5 courses in civil Engineering?
responses: For every PG Course, there should be at least one Professor with Ph.D. qualification. Refer Appendix 7 of APH 2020-21.

patterns: How the Mega and Metro Cities, Urban Area and Rural Area have been determined?
How are they classifying the cities into Mega/Metro/Urban/Rural?
responses: The classification of cities has been made as per Census 2011 data.

patterns: We are currently running Diploma in Pharmacy and we want to apply Under Graduate Degree Course in Pharmacy. Can we share the Laboratories and Faculty with Diploma in Pharmacy?
responses: Refer to Appendix 4 of APH 2020-21.

patterns: Our Institution has six UG Engineering Courses. How many Seminar Halls we need for running UG Programme?
How many Seminar Halls do we need for running 6 UG Engineering courses?
responses: One. Refer Appendix 4 of APH 2020-21.

patterns: What is the duration of MCA Course?
Can you please say me the duration MCA course?
responses: Two Years. Hence Lateral Entry is not permissible.

patterns: Whether our Institution can start ITI with same Infrastructure available in our Polytechnic?
responses: Yes. Refer Chapter VII of APH 2020-21. The Institutions may conduct skill development Courses of any other Regulatory Body using the existing facilities, or by creating additional facilities as per the provisions laid down in the norms and standards of the respective Regulatory Bodies without affecting the quality of education prescribed by both Regulatory Bodies after taking NOC from the Council.

patterns: We have an Approved Intake of 60 seats in Electronics and Communication Engineering in UG Course. Now we want to reduce the Intake by 30 in Electronics and Communication Engineering and in lieu of it can we would like to add the one Division of 30 students in lateral entry in Engineering UG Course.
responses: It is not permissible.

patterns: Our Institution wants to make admission under Lateral Entry in Engineering and Technology. Is there any provision in APH 2020-21?
Whether Lateral Entry is permitted in Diploma?
Whether students from SAARC Countries/ Foreign Nationals are permitted to admit under Lateral Entry in Engineering Courses?
responses: Refer Clause 7.14 of APH 2020-21.

patterns: Can we convert our First and Second Shift Diploma Courses into Degree Courses?

We were running First Shift (180) and Second Shift (120), currently the portal shows a single number with both the Intakes. Because of this, we are getting deficiencies. Please change the Intake as that of the last year.
responses: The Courses offered in the timings of Regular Shift, First Shift, Second Shift and Part Time shall be considered as Regular Courses. The Institutions shall have to fulfil all facilities such as Infrastructure, Faculty and other requirements to offer the Regular Courses as per the norms specified in the Approval Process Handbook for the Total Approved Intake and the Institutions may conduct the Courses in the timings of Regular Shift, First Shift, Second Shift and Part Time not exceeding the 'Approved Intake' of each Course, as per the convenience of all stakeholders. All such Institutions shall create the necessary Faculty, Infrastructure and other facilities WITHIN 2 YEARS to fulfil the norms. Student enrolment details shall be uploaded in the Web-Portal. Hence the Council will consider the issue of EoA till such time.

patterns: Whether Faculty not recruited on Regular basis shall be considered for Faculty Student ratio?
responses: The contractual Faculty who have taught for 2 consecutive semesters in the preceding Academic Year on Full Time basis ONLY shall be considered for the purpose of calculation of Faculty.

patterns: We would like to apply for a new Course, but the nomenclature is not available in the drop down. How to apply?
responses: If any Institution proposes to start a new Course whose nomenclature is not available in Appendix 2 of the Approval Process Handbook, prior concurrence, as the case may be, by the Council for the same shall be necessary. For such concurrence, the Institution with due endorsement by the Registrar/ Director of affiliating University/ Board/ Technical Institution shall submit detailed Syllabus and Curriculum and its nomenclature to the Policy and Academic Planning Bureau, AICTE before 30th September of the Calendar Year, to process the same in the respective Board.

patterns: We are Standalone Institutions offering PGDM Courses. Can we apply for ODL Courses?
Can standalone Institutions offerring PGDM Courses apply for the ODL Courses?
responses: Yes. Refer Chapter V of APH 2020-21.

patterns: Ours is a Deemed to be University/ Private University established under UGC Act offering Technical Programmes but not seeking approval from AICTE. What is the procedure for getting the Programmes approved by AICTE during 2019-20?

Our University is 07 years old Private University approved by UGC. Whether Private University running technical Programmes/ Courses in Engineering, Management, Architecture, MCA, etc. are required to obtain AICTE approval?
responses: Institutions Deemed to be Universities seeking approval for the first time from AICTE (in compliance to the order dated 03.11.2017 passed by the Supreme Court Order CA No. 17869-17870 / 2017) shall submit an application as a new Technical Institution. Private Universities interested in seeking approval for the first time from AICTE may submit an application as a new Technical Institution.

patterns: Whether a State Technical University is required to take approval of AICTE to conduct technical Courses.
responses: Universities do not require prior approval of AICTE to commence a new Department or Course and Programme(s) in Technical Education, however Universities have obligation or duty to conform to the standards; and norms laid down by the AICTE.

patterns: What is the last date of submission of hard copy application at Regional Office for the applications?
responses: HARD  COPIES   OF   THE   APPLICATION/   ADDITIONAL   DOCUMENTS   NEED   NOT   BE SUBMITTED TO THE REGIONAL OFFICE. Applications other than those for Extension of Approval to be processed by the Scrutiny/ Re-Scrutiny Committee shall present their application and ALL original documents along with self-attested copies before the Committee. Refer APH for the documents (as applicable) to be uploaded in the Web-Portal.

patterns: Our Institution was approved as a Private/ Un-aided Institution. Recently our Institution has been recognized as minority Institution. How to update this change in AICTE Portal?
responses: You can apply in the Portal. Refer Clause 2.24 of APH 2020-21.

patterns: In a State, if one University is merged with another University, how to change the name of the affiliating University under Course Tab.
how to change the name of the affiliating University under Course Tab if 2 universities are merged in a state?
responses: Select the option 'do you want to change the Affiliating University?' Then select Yes and select the name of new affiliating University from the drop down menu. Contact Approval Bureau along with a request letter in the Letter head of the Institution enclosing copies of State Government resolution/ Gazette Notification. In such cases, NOC form State Government/ University are not required.

patterns: Our Institution has extended EoA upto 2022. When we apply in the Portal for Increase in Intake, the Portal is calculating the TER Charges. Are we not exempted from payment?
responses: Institutions approved for extended EoA are waived from paying TER Charges for Extension of Approval (EoA) ONLY for the extended years for the existing Programme(s) and Course(s) at the time of issue of Extended EoA. However, such Institutions are required to submit the application for EoA and maintain ALL the norms and standards as specified in the Approval Process Handbook. In the subsequent years, if the Institution intends to apply for any other categories, the corresponding TER Charges as per Approval Process Handbook shall be paid.

patterns: Name of our affiliating University does not appear in the affiliating University drop down.
responses: Contact Approval Bureau for inclusion of the University name in the portal. Send an email of Institution representation on the Letter head to helpdeskab@aicte-india.org.

patterns: Our Institution has become a University. Do we have to apply as a new University under Chapter I or can we apply for EoA as a University?
responses: You can apply for change of Type of Institution. Refer Clause 2.23 of APH 2020-21.

patterns: Our Institution wants to change the name of the Course. What is the procedure?
What is the procedure to change the name of the course?
responses: Refer Clause 2.22 of APH 2020-21.

patterns: As per APH 2020-21, option for merging of Institutions which are running under same Trust/ Society is mentioned. We have one Engineering and one Pharmacy Institution under our Society. Can we merge them?

We are Integrated Campus from 2010 running Courses in Engineering, Pharmacy and Management Programmes. We are interested to take additional Diploma Course in existing Pharmacy (UG) Institution. Can you suggest how to proceed for the same?
responses: It is permissible. Refer Clause 2.10 of APH 2020-21. However, the norms of the concerned Regulatory Bodies shall also be fulfilled.

patterns: Can we merge few Courses of a Child Institution with Parent Institution and run the Child Institution with the remaining Courses?
responses: Not permissible.

patterns: Can we merge an Institution running Under Graduate Courses and a Polytechnic in Engineering?
Can we merge 2 institutions one running UG course and another running polytechnic?
responses: Yes. You can

patterns: Can we merge two Institutions located within a distance of 5km in the same City?
If 2 institutes are located within the disatance of 5km can we merge them?
responses: If all the required facilities are available exclusively in the Parent Institution (without depending on the facilities of the Child Institution(s)), then the distance of 2km shall be waived off, as the Child Institution(s) shall be considered for Complete Closure. Refer Clause 2.10 of APH 2020-21.

patterns: Where I can find information related to Approval Process ?
Informations related to approval process will be available at
responses: Information related to Approval Process  can be found on AICTE Home page under Quick Links (Approval Process 2019-20).

patterns: When I try to login with Institute's Credentials, error message 'Invalid username and password' is displayed. What should I do?
I am unable to login to the institute's credential, an error occurs
while login to the institute's credential , it displays an error message
responses: : Recheck the login credentials (Case sensitive). Confirm whether someone else has logged in with the same credentials (Please note that per user only 3 sessions are allowed. Hence, if someone tries for 4th session then again invalid user name and password message will popup). If no session is live and still getting an invalid username and password message, then the password might be incorrect. In such cases, you can Request for forgot password

patterns: I am not able to find some tabs in AICTE Web Portal.
In AICTE web portal, some tabs are not available
responses: All sub tabs are available under drop down or You may find all available tabs in one page by Sitemap option. Sitemap option is available in Navigate Menu. Shortcut Keyboard key for Sitemap is Ctrl+Shift+A.

patterns: I am not able to generate report?
how to generate report
responses: Please refer âUser Manual for Report Generationâ to generate Reports.

patterns: How to delete old faculty details?
how to remove faculty details
pop faculty details
responses: Faculty record cannot be deleted. Faculty can be marked as Duplicate or Left the Institute in Faculty Details tab.

patterns: Is Aadhaar/PAN details mandatory to update faculty details in AICTE Web Portal?
any details are needed to update faculty details
any id proof is needed to update faculty details
responses: yes

patterns: How to add re-joined faculty in AICTE Web Portal Click on Left the Institute tab.
can we add re-joined faculty and how
in AICTE web portal,how we can add the re-joined faculty details
responses: Enter date of re-joining. Automatically it will get reflected on Web portal.

patterns: I have made Online Payment but amount is not updated in portal.
I am not able to make payment because AICTE Website is not directing to Payment Gateway.
Where to send the queries related to portal, payment and approval related issues
responses: Generally, payment receipt gets updated immediately. In case, your payment receipt is not updated then click on View Transaction Button under Payment tab. Otherwise, it will get updated within 48 working hours (2 working days). In case it is not updated even after that, please send details of the transaction (Transaction Id generated while making the payment) and application through Grievance form.

Generally, payment receipt gets updated immediately. In case, your payment receipt is not updated then click on View Transaction Button under Payment tab. Otherwise, it will get updated within 48 working hours (2 working days). In case it is not updated even after that, please send details  of the transaction (Transaction Id generated while making the payment) and application through Grievance form.
Please Visit Directory on AICTE Website Home page (bottom).

patterns: What we have to do in case we face server busy message?
if server is busy what to do
displays server is busy
responses: If you are getting Server, busy message in this case please refresh your screen or try again after sometime.

patterns: We want to change details which are non-editable / read-only?
responses: The details which are seen non-editable cannot be changed beyond the specified schedule for uploading details; you may contact the Approval Bureau.

patterns: I have saved my data. But same is not reflecting in âCalculate Deficiencyâ tab.
whether there may  be any problem in calculate deficiency
responses: Please Click on calculate deficiency button, refresh the page and check

patterns: By mistake, I have submitted my application. Is it possible to reopen the application once again to update the few details?
can I update my datils in already submitted application
responses: If you have not created any payment record under Payment tab then you can re-open the submitted application only once by clicking on âre-open applicationâ button available under Attachments and Submit tab. Note: After re-open, the application should be resubmitted. dOtherwise application will be treated as âApplication Not Submittedâ.

patterns: I have applied for forgot password but still I did not receive password on my registered email?
still I did not receive the password in email,but I have already applied for forgot password
responses: Institute need to submit the Affidavit-1 in the respective Regional Office. Regional Officer will flag the Affidavit Received against your request on web portal. Then password will be sent to the instituteâs registered email id. Please check the Spam Folder also in your mailbox for forgot password email. In case of any issue, you may raise your grievance online by Grievance link available @ https://aicte-india.org/bureaus/approval/ap_2021-22
